# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(str::AbstractString; text_width::Int=10)
    lines = []
    start = 1
    for (i, c) in enumerate(str)
        if i > text_width || c == ' '
            push!(lines, str[start:i-1])
            start = i + 1 if c == ' '
        end
    end
    push!(lines, str[start:end])
    return lines
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
julia> wrap_string("Hello there this is a very long sentence that will wrap at text_width=10")
3-element Array{String,1}:
 "Hello there this is a very"
 "long sentence that will wrap"
 "at text_width=10"
```
